review: It's not a bad unit for streaming video, as well as playing music and games. But the one thing it's not is a full-on Android TV box, which would let you surf the Internet on your TV and use Facebook, among other things. The remote is quite functional for what it does with the GUI that the Fire TV has. Just be careful to know what you're getting if you plan on getting this device. If you want a full-on Android TV box, you may be better off looking elsewhere for one.UPDATE: Though not a full-on Android TV box, you can use sideloading apps on your Android device to install other types of Android-compatible apps onto your Fire TV device, including web browsers. All you need is a wireless keyboard-touchpad with a USB dongle access the apps you might not be able to use your remote or game controller with.

review: DATA USAGE IS UNBELIEVABLY HIGH!While the functionality of Fire TV is very good, and video streaming of Amazon Prime video content is excellent, data usage is unbelievably high.  A HD movie should stream at a data rate up to 3.5 Mb/sec.  At that rate, a 2 hour movie should consume about 2 GB of my data plan.  The actual data used was a bit over 10 GB.  TEN GIGABYTES!Yes, I'm sure it used 10 GB just for this movie.  I was running a test connecting through Verizon 4G where I have a 40 GB/month data plan.  I'm near the end of the billing cycle and had leftover bandwidth.  So I streamed a Prime Movie to see the data usage.  Verizon showed a change in total data usage of over 10 GB from before the movie to after the movie.  Nothing else going on.Amazon needs to fix the data usage and get it to a reasonable level.  HD should take around 1 GB / hour and SD less.

review: Got our Fire TV today and I am quite impressed with this product. First the Fire TV is tiny, but packs a punch! We plugged it into the HDMI port on our TV (cable sold separately), turned it on and away we went. It was already set up for my Amazon account. The only setup I had to do was connect it to our router.Once online - it has an informative, short video on how to use the Fire TV. I love the Voice Search on the remote, how cool is that? And yes it works. You have to speak to it 3 times in the beginning so it learns your voice, but no biggie! Another neat feature is how they list the top Prime Movies and Shows right on the home page.If you have an interest in a show or movie just click and add to your watch list. We streamed our first movie tonight and it was a great experience. The clarity of the movie was perfect. I expected it to be a bit choppy with streaming but it wasn't. The picture was crystal clear, the volume and sound were great.Overall, my household is very happy with our new Fire TV!
